item.title: Meghan add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "I was not a lovable child, and I'd grown into a deeply unlovable adult. Draw a picture of my soul, and it'd be a scribble with fangs." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "I used to think the world was broken down by tribes,' I said. 'By Black and White. By Indian and White. But I know this isn't true. The world is only broken into two tribes: the people who are assholes and the people who are not." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Everywhere I go I'm asked if I think the university stifles writers. My opinion is that they don't stifle enough of them. There's many a best-seller that could have been prevented by a good teacher." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Nathaniel Rich
item.description: "The way other people fantasize about surprise inheritances, firts-glance love, and endless white empyreal pastures, Mitchell dreamed of an erupting supervolcano that would bury North America under a foot of hot ash." -- Nathaniel Rich

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Cintra Wilson
item.description: "Stop pathetically believing that you deserve fame or fame deserves you. It's yucky, and it's only making you miserable, so stop." -- Cintra Wilson

item.title: Meghan add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description:
"This Vladimir Brusiloff to whom I have referred was the famous Russian novelist. . . . Vladimir specialized in gray studies of hopeless misery, where nothing happened till page three hundred and eighty, when the moujik decided to commit suicide. . . .
Cuthbert was an optimist at heart, and it seemed to him that, at the rate at which the inhabitants of that interesting country were murdering one another, the supply of Russian novelists must eventually give out." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Meghan add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "At the age of eleven or thereabouts women acquire a poise and an ability to handle difficult situations which a man, if he is lucky, manages to achieve somewhere in the later seventies." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Meghan add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "I could see that, if not actually disgruntled, he was far from being gruntled." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Meghan add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "There is no surer foundation for a beautiful friendship than a mutual taste in literature." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Meghan add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "I am not always good and noble. I am the hero of this story, but I have my off moments." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Meghan add a quote by A.M. Homes
item.description: "There is a world out there, so new, so random and disassociated that it puts us all in danger. We talk online, we ‘friend’ each other when we don’t know who we are really talking to – we fuck strangers. We mistake almost anything for a relationship, a community of sorts, and yet, when we are with our families, in our communities, we are clueless, we short-circuit and immediately dive back into the digitized version – it is easier, because we can be both our truer selves and our fantasy selves all at once, with each carrying equal weight." -- A.M. Homes

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "As my father always used to tell me, 'You see, son, there's always someone in the world worse off than you.' And I always used to think, 'So?" -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Meghan add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "No thief, however skillful, can rob one of knowledge, and that is why knowledge is the best and safest treasure to acquire." -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Meghan add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Saying 'I notice you're a nerd' is like saying, 'Hey, I notice that you'd rather be intelligent than be stupid, that you'd rather be thoughtful than be vapid, that you believe that there are things that matter more than the arrest record of Lindsay Lohan. Why is that?' In fact, it seems to me that most contemporary insults are pretty lame. Even 'lame' is kind of lame. Saying 'You're lame' is like saying 'You walk with a limp.' Yeah, whatever, so does 50 Cent, and he's done all right for himself." -- John Green
